gurmukhi: ਸਿਮੱਟਿ ਸਾਂਗ ਸੁੰਕੜੰ ਸਟੱਕ ਸੂਲ ਸੇਲਯੰ || ਰੁਲੰਤ ਰੁੰਡ ਮੁੰਡਯੰ ਝਲੰਤ ਝਾਲ ਅੱਝਲੰ ||੩੧੫||
transliteration: Simatttee Saan Sounkdan Satakk Sool Selyan|| Rulant Round Mounndyan Jhalant Dhaal Ajjhalan||315||
translation: The daggers and spears are producing rustling sound and the chopped dead heads, having rolled in dust, are scattered here and there.315.

gurmukhi: ਬਚਿੱਤ੍ਰ ਚਿੱਤ੍ਰਤੰ ਸਰੰ ਬਹੰਤ ਦਾਰੁਣੰ ਰਣੰ || ਢਲੰਤ ਢਾਲ ਅੱਢਲੰ ਢੁਲੰਤ ਚਾਰ ਚਾਮਰੰ ||
transliteration: Bachittra Chittratan Saran Bahant Daarounan Ranan|| Dhalant Dhaal Addhalan Chaar Chaamran||
translation: The peculiar types of arrows, drawing pictures are being discharged in the battlefield and the knocking of the spears in the battlefield and the knocking of the spears in the shields is being heard.

gurmukhi: ਦਲੰਤ ਨਿਰਦਲੋ ਦਲੰ ਪਪਾਤ ਭੂਤਲੰ ਦਿਤੰ || ੳੁਠੰਤ ਗੱਦਿ ਸੱਦਯੰ ਨਿਨੱਦਿ ਨੱਦਿ ਦੁੱਭਰੰ ||੩੧੬||
transliteration: Dalant Nirdalo Dalan Papaat Bhootlan Ditan|| Outhant Gad(i) Saddyan Ninadd(i) Nadd(i) Doubbharan||316||
translation: The armies are being mashed and the earth is getting hot (because of the hot blood), the dreadful sound is being heard continuously form all four sides.316.

gurmukhi: ਭਰੰਤ ਪੱਤ੍ਰ ਚੳੁਸਠੀ ਕਿਲੰਕ ਖੇਚਰੀ ਕਰੰ || ਫਿਰੰਤ ਹੂਰ ਪੂਰਯੰ ਬਰੰਤ ਦੁੱਧਰੰ ਨਰੰ ||
transliteration: Bharant Pattra Chaousathikilank Khechrikaran|| Phirant Hoor Poorayan Barant Duddhran Naran||
translation: Sixty-four Yoginis, shouting loudly, are filling their pots with colour and the heavenly damsels are moving on the earth in order to wed the great horses;

gurmukhi: ਸਨੱਧ ਬੱਧ ਗੋਧਯੰ ਸੁ ਸੋਭ ਅੰਗੁਲੰ ਤ੍ਰਿਣੰ || ਡਕੰਤ ਡਾਕਣੀ ਭ੍ਰਮੰ ਭਖੰਤ ਅਾਮਿਖੰ ਰਣੰ ||੩੧੭||
transliteration: Sanaddh Baddh Godhayan Su Sobh Anulan Trinan|| Dakant Daakanibhramannd Bhakhannddaamikhanndranan||317||
translation: The heroes, bedecking themselves are wearing armours on their hands and the vampires are roaring in the battlefield, eating flesh and bellowing.317.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਲੰਕ ਦੇਵੀਯੰ ਕਰੰਡ ਹੱਕ ਡਾਮਰੂ ਸੁਰੰ || ਕੜੱਕ ਕੱਤੀਯੰ ੳੁਠੰ ਪਰੰਤ ਧੂਰ ਪੱਖਰੰ ||
transliteration: Kilank Deveeyan Karand Hack Daadaroo|| Kadakk Kattyan Outhaaan Parant Dhoor Pakkhran||
translation: The loud voice of the goddess Kali, who drinks blood, and the sound of tabor are being heard, the dreadful laughter is being heard in the battlefield and the dust settled on armours is also being seen;

gurmukhi: ਬਬੱਜਿ ਸਿੰਧਰੇ ਸੁਰੰ ਨ੍ਰਿਘਾਤ ਸੂਲ ਸੈਹਥੀਯੰ || ਭਭੱਜਿ ਕਾਤਰੋ ਰਣੰ ਨਿਲੱਜ ਭੱਜ ਭੂ ਭਰੰ ||੩੧੮||
transliteration: Babajj(i) Sinddare Suran Nrighaa Sool Saihtheeyan|| Bhabhajj(i) Kaadaro Ranan Nilajj Bhajj Bhoo Bharan||318||
translation: The elephants and horses are creating noise on being struck with the blows of sword and abandoning their shyness and being helpless, they are running away from the war.318.

gurmukhi: ਸੁ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਸੰਨਿਧੰ ਜੁਝੰਤ ਜੋਧਣੋ ਜੁੱਧੰ || ਅਰੁੱਝ ਪੰਕ ਲੱਜਣੰ ਕਰੰਤ ਦ੍ਰੋਹ ਕੇਵਲੰ ||
transliteration: Su Sastra Astra Sannidhan Jujhant Jodhano Juddhan|| Arujjh Pank Lajjanan Karant Droh Kevalan||
translation: Having been bedecked with arms and weapons the warriors are busy in war and not being stuck in the mud of shyness they are waging war;

gurmukhi: ਪਰੰਤ ਅੰਗ ਭੰਗ ਹੁਅੈ ੳੁਠੰਤ ਮਾਸ ਕਰਦਮੰ || ਖਿਲੰਤ ਜਾਣੁ ਕਦਵੰ ਸੁ ਮੱਝ ਕਾਨ੍ਹ ਗੋਪਿਕੰ ||੩੧੯||
transliteration: Prant An Bhan Huai Outhant Maas Kardamannd|| Khilant Jaan(u) Kadavan Su Majhh Kaahn Gopikan||319||
translation: Being filled with ire, the limbs and the bits of flesh of the warriors are falling on the earth like Krishna playing amongst Gopis by throwing up the ball from this to that side.319.

gurmukhi: ਡਹੱਕ ਡੳੁਰ ਡਾਕਣੰ ਝਲੰਤ ਝਾਲ ਰੋਸੁਰੰ || ਨਿਨੱਦ ਨਾਦ ਨਾਫਿਰੰ ਬਜੰਤ ਭੇਰ ਭੀਖਣੰ ||
transliteration: Dahakk Daur Daakanan Jhalant Dhaal Rosuran|| Ninadd Naad Naaphiran Bajant Bher Bheekhanan||
translation: The tabors and famous gestures of the vampires are being seen and the dreadful sound of drums and fifes is being heard.

gurmukhi: ਘੁਰੰਤ ਘੋਰ ਦੁੰਦਭੀ ਕਰੰਤ ਕਾਨਰੇ ਸੁਰੰ || ਕਰੰਤ ਝਾਝਰੋ ਝੜੰ ਬਜੰਤ ਬਾਂਸੁਰੀ ਬਰੰ ||੩੨੦||
transliteration: Ghurant Ghor Doundabhikarant Kaadare Suran|| Karant Jhaajdaro Jhatan Bajant Baansuribaran||320||
translation: The terrible sound of big drums is being heard in the ears. The jingling of anklets and the sweet voice of flutes are also being heard in the battlefield.320.

gurmukhi: ਨਚੰਤ ਬਾਜ ਤੀਛਣੰ ਚਲੰਤ ਚਾਚਰੀ ਕ੍ਰਿਤੰ || ਲਿਖੰਤ ਲੀਕ ੳੁਰਬੀਅੰ ਸੁਭੰਤ ਕੁੰਡਲੀ ਕਰੰ ||
transliteration: Nachannd Baaj Teechhanan Chalant Chaancharikritan|| Likhanndleek Urbeean Soubhant Koundalikaran||
translation: The swift horses are dancing and moving swiftly and with their gait they are creating coiled marks on the earth.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਡੰਤ ਧੂਰ ਭੂਰਿਯੰ ਖੁਰੀਨ ਨਿਰਦਲੀ ਨਭੰ || ਪਰੰਤ ਭੂਰ ਭੳੁਰਣੰ ਸੁ ਭੳੁਰ ਠੳੁਰ ਜਿੳੁ ਜਲੰ ||੩੨੧||
transliteration: Udant Dhoor Bhooreeyan Khureen Nirdalibabhan|| Parant Bhoor Bhauranan Su Bhaur Thaur Jio Jalan||321||
translation: Because of the sound of their hoofs, the dust is rising upto the sky and seems like the whirlpool in water.321.

gurmukhi: ਭਜੰਤ ਧੀਰ ਬੀਰਣੰ ਚਲੰਤ ਮਾਨ ਪ੍ਰਾਨ ਲੈ || ਦਲੰਤ ਪੰਤ ਦੰਤੀਯੰ ਭਜੰਤ ਹਾਰ ਮਾਨ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Bhajant Dheer Beernan Chalant Maan Praan Lai|| Dalant Pant Danteeyan Bhajant Haar Maan Kai||
translation: The enduring warriors are fleeing with their honour and life-breath and the lines of the elephants have been destroyed;
